IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Narrative On 4/16/2023, the Salisbury Police Department responded to 301 East Carroll Street for a reported shooting. Two victims were located at the scene and one was pronounced dead after transportation to the hospital. The MSP Homicide Unit was contacted and requested to lead the investigation. Reports and supplements will be completed in the MSP Homicide word format and uploaded to this report at the conclusion of the investigation. Case Status OPEN/PENDING Primary Investigator CPL WILDMAN #6591 - MSP HOMICIDE UNIT

Investigation Supplement (For review by the MSPCrash Team) Section I. - Narrative On 4/16/2023 at approximately 0316 hours, I, Sgt. Daniel Rumaker #5661 of the Maryland State Police Crash Team was requested to assist the Maryland State Police Homicide Unit with forensically mapping a homicide scene in Salisbury, Maryland. A report documenting my assistance is attached. Conclusion: Upon approval, this supplement will be provided to Cpl. John Wildman #6591 of MSP Homicide for part of his investigation. Author: Sergeant Daniel R. Rumaker #5661 MSP Crash Team North East Office 2433 Pulaski Highway North East, Maryland 21901 410-996-7838 Daniel.Rumaker@Maryland.Gov

FOCUS OF THIS SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT: This report documents my initial response in regard to the murder investigation of JaSiah SinCer Basnight- Johnson on 04/16/2023. The initial incident occurred in the Pizza City Parking lot, located at 301 E. Carroll Street, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland 21804. NARRATIVE: On Sunday, 04/16/2023 at approximately 0118 hours, I was notified by Sgt. Stephen Hallman (Acting Detective Sergeant of the CED Homicide Unit Eastern Region) in reference to a shooting that had occurred outside the Pizza City restaurant where one male, later identified as JaSiah SinCer Basnight- Johnson, herein referred to as Johnson, had succumbed to his injuries. Sgt. Hallman advised that there was a second shooting victim, later identified as JaMere Capri Maynes, AA/M, DOB: 0610/2001, herein referred to as Maynes. I was directed to respond to TidalHealth Peninsula Medical Center, located at 100 E. Carroll Street, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland in order to contact the victims as well as process any evidence. Upon arrival at 0229 hours, I observed Cpl. Connor Willey of the Maryland State Police Homicide Unit already interviewing hospital staff regarding the victim(s) conditions. CRIME SCENE PROCESSING HOSPITAL: At 0229 hours, I arrived at Tidal Health and met with the SPD officers securing both hospital rooms. CST Melissa Harvey (Maryland State Police Crime Scene Technician), who was assigned crime scene technician for the investigation responded to Tidal Health Peninsula in order to process the hospital scene. CST Harvey was able to take photographs of Johnson inside the emergency room, as well as his injuries. Johnson had an apparent gunshot wound to his head as well as multiple gunshot wounds along his back and body. I assisted CST Harvey with collecting Johnsons property and clothing from his room. I noted that Johnsons clothing was removed by the hospital staff and placed into a brown paper bag for law enforcement. I noted that there were no weapons or cellular devices within Johnsons property or clothing. CST Harvey advised she would photograph the clothing at a separate date and time. CST Harvey and I began processing the second hospital room where Maynes was being treated for his gunshot wounds. I noted Maynes was conscious and able to speak. While Cpl. Willey interviewed Maynes, I assisted CST Harvey with processing and collecting Maynes clothing and property from within the room. I noted that hospital staff had already removed Maynes clothing prior to our arrival and placed it in a pile within the room. CST Harvey was able to photograph Maynes injuries and advised she would photograph Maynes clothing more thoroughly at a later date and time. While searching Maynes clothing, I located two-dollar bills US Currency, one yellow condom wrapper, and a white air pod container without the air pods. I collected those items and released them to Maynes mother in the hospital lobby that same day. F.I. (Forensic Investigator) Charles C. Ward responded to the hospital scene. OCME Case No. 23-04832. F.I. Ward advised Johnson would be transported to the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner in Baltimore, Maryland for a full autopsy. SPD investigator Barkley and I met with the next of kin, identified as Diere Horsy (sister) and Sharron Horsey (brother), in a separate hospital room near the lobby. I noted that both subjects were extremely distraught and emotional. Notification was made to the next of kin regarding Johnsons death. The family was unable to provide any information regarding the incident. Diere Horsy provided me with a telephone number of (443) 754-2159 for Johnson, who she identified as Jo. CRIME SCENE PROCESSING (PIZZA CITY E. CARROLL ST): I responded to Pizza City parking lot and was briefed by Sgt. Hallman. I was tasked with remaining at the scene and assisting CSTs process evidence. CST Harvey and CST Woods were assigned with processing the scene. The following items were photographed and collected: PMC SW .40 caliber brass cartridge casings JAG 9mm brass cartridge casings CBC 9mm brass cartridge casings Blazer 9mm brass cartridge casing Hornaday 9mm Aluminum cartridge casings Projectile/fragments One (1) baseball hat Two (2) cellular phones (victims) collected from the parking lot near visible blood For further information, refer to CST Woods and CST Harveys crime scene report and notes. CRIME SCENE PROCESSING (401 EASTERN SHORE DRIVE): I learned that the building across the street from Pizza City was struck by projectiles. CST Woods photographed the damage. CST Woods and CST Harvey located the following ballistic evidence at the scene: One projectile, from in the parking lot One jacketed projectile, near the projectile in the parking lot Photographs of one bullet hole in the window frame, possible deflection (projectile possibly deflected off of the building onto the ground) For further information, refer to CST Woods and CST Harveys crime scene report and notes. CONSENT SEARCH HYUNDAI VEHICLE: I contacted the registered owner identified as Oynx Best, AA/F, DOB: 09/24/1998, who provided investigators consent to search her vehicle which was parked in the Pizza City Parking lot. Oynx was identified as Maynes girlfriend. CST Woods and CST Harvey took photographs of the vehicle. I noted that Maynes retreated to this vehicle after being shot. Blood was visible outside and inside the vehicle. The following items were seized from the vehicle: One black Samsung phone (Oynx claimed the device located in the center console area was her work phone provided to her by Walmart and that the phone did not have a telephone number assigned to it) The black Samsung phone was provided to the lead investigator at the Salisbury Police Department. For further information, refer to the consent search form. All the above events occurred in Wicomico County, Maryland. Assigned Investigator: S/Tpr. Kristi Allen Lead Investigator: Cpl. John Wildman Investigative Time: 12 Hours
